intro: Seaforthia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf seaforthia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 2 centimeters wide. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to coastal regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
